name: Basic Scripting and Programming
description: This Knowledge Unit (KU) provides students with foundational skills in scripting and programming. It focuses on enabling students to write simple scripts to automate tasks, perform basic programming operations, and incorporate fundamental security practices into their code.
outcomes: Identify common scripting languages used in programming.
Recall basic programming constructs such as variables, loops, and conditionals.
Explain the purpose of scripting and programming in automation.
Describe basic security practices in developing scripts/programs.
Write simple scripts to automate system administration tasks.
Implement basic security practices in scripts, such as input validation and error handling.
Debug scripts to identify and fix errors.
Analyze the performance of scripts in different environments.
Assess the effectiveness of scripts in automating tasks.
Evaluate the security of scripts and programs.
Develop scripts to solve specific problems or automate tasks.
Construct programs that incorporate multiple scripting techniques and security practices.
topics: Overview of Common Scripting Languages (Python, Bash, PowerShell, etc.)
Real-World Examples of Scripting in Cybersecurity
notes: Special instructions or explanations: Emphasize practical applications and hands-on activities., Provide real-world examples and case studies to illustrate the use of scripting and programming., Highlight the importance of security practices in script development.
